title: Senate Democrats Pass $1.9 Trillion Covid-19 Relief Plan
summary: Legislation providing jobless benefits and direct payments now returns to the House for approval before it is sent to President Biden. WASHINGTON-Senate Democrats passed President Biden's $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief package Saturday by the slimmest of margins, following an intraparty standoff over unemployment benefits.

title: Study of Aggressive Covid-19 Strain in Brazil Suggests Limits of China Vaccine
summary: As P.1 variant spreads, concerns arise over how effective existing vaccines might be against new strains of the coronavirus. SÃO PAULO-As an aggressive coronavirus strain from the Amazon ravages Brazil, a preliminary study has provided the first evidence that the country's principal vaccine, China's CoronaVac, might not be as effective against it.

title: Democrats' Minimum-Wage Setback Could Kick-Start Talks With Republicans
summary: Progressives want $15 an hour while others see chance for compromise at lower level. WASHINGTON-Democrats' failure to pass a minimum-wage increase could spur bipartisan negotiations to bridge the big gap between the party's progressive wing, its centrists and Republican senators on raising workers' pay.

title: Top Official Ousted Over Covid-19 Nursing-Home Deaths Stayed on N.J. Payroll for Months
summary: Gov. Phil Murphy had called for manager's replacement 'effective immediately'. New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy ousted a top state official in mid-October as part of a reckoning over the Covid-19 crisis at the state's nursing homes for veterans, but the official was never fired, state records show.

title: U.S. Capitol Fence Should Come Down, Many Residents and Lawmakers Say
summary: Four miles of security fencing was put up after Jan. 6 attack; police say a permanent barrier is needed. Calls are growing for federal officials to take down the roughly 4 miles of security fencing put up by Capitol Police to protect the U.S. Capitol complex after the building was stormed on Jan. 6.

title: Some Broadway Producers Expect Curtains to Rise in Fall
summary: Even as New York state eases Covid-19 restrictions on venues, some musicals and other shows won't return for months. As New York state continues to ease pandemic restrictions, cultural spaces are coming back to life. Movie theaters in New York City were able to open with reduced capacity March 5. Arts and entertainment venues can welcome back attendees April 2, with a maximum of 100 people indoors.

summary: Dating apps are taking a platonic turn. Relationships come and go, but friends are forever. At least, that is the direction dating apps are swiping.

title: Amicus Briefs Inundate Supreme Court
summary: Friend-of-the-court filings reach records and draw renewed scrutiny. WASHINGTON-Does the Supreme Court have too many secret admirers?

title: A Look Into the Magical Apartment of the Chairman of Acne Studios
summary: The renegade energy that allowed Acne Studios chairman Mikael Schiller to turn a cult fashion brand into a global phenomenon is on full display in his Stockholm apartment. The first question that comes to mind as Mikael Schiller shows you around his new place in Stockholm is, What's a mild-mannered Swedish bachelor in his mid-40s doing in a place like this? The apartment runs to more than 4,600 square feet over two floors. A sweeping staircase spirals up between them, with a 1944 Steinway sprawled underneath (Schiller doesn't play). Schiller's personal bathroom upstairs has four doors-five if you count an old entrance door to the apartment, now unused. That seems like a lot.

title: The Battle for Barcelona's Leadership
summary: After a yearslong decline, Barça fans prepare to choose a president. But all they really want is for Messi to stay.. One candidate to become Football Club Barcelona's president proposed naming the cub's stadium after Lionel Messi immediately. Another floated the idea of rehiring Pep Guardiola to coach the struggling team back to greatness. Then there was the hopeful who promised to reimburse every member's season ticket if he couldn't lure Barça legend Xavi Hernandez back to the club from Qatar.

title: Why Covid-19 Vaccine Rollout Falls Short of Past Global Campaigns
summary: Decades-old successes benefited from more trust in science, less political polarization, less complicated procedures. After briefly waiting in line, William Schaffner and his father joined six million people in greater New York who were vaccinated in just over three weeks, a logistical feat made possible by seamless cooperation between local and federal authorities.

title: Microsoft, Wells Fargo Satisfied U.S. on Hiring More Black Employees
summary: Companies were asked to prove their hiring plans complied with antidiscrimination laws. WASHINGTON-The Labor Department under the Trump administration closed inquiries into Microsoft Corp. and Wells Fargo & Co. after the companies responded to questions about their plans to hire more Black employees, according to an agency spokesman.

title: Haley, Noem Differ in Approach to Trump as 2024 Jockeying Begins
summary: One of the two women in prospective GOP White House field has sought distance from former president, while the other has embraced him. The only two women to appear so far on early lists of potential 2024 Republican presidential candidates-Nikki Haley and Kristi Noem-have taken divergent paths in their navigation around the still sizable political shadow of former President Donald Trump.

title: Job Losses During Pandemic Strain Black, Hispanic Women's Personal Finances
summary: Some women of color make difficult decisions and change their lifestyles to stay afloat. The pandemic has taken a toll on many women's finances. For some Black and Hispanic women, in particular, the financial pressure is intensifying.

title: How to Understand the Small-Stock Rally
summary: Small-caps are drubbing large ones this year. What does it mean for what's ahead?. Small stocks so far this year have beaten their large-capitalization brethren by a wider margin than they have in more than two decades, raising questions about what is driving the outperformance and what it means for the overall market ahead.

title: China-Linked Hack Hits Thousands of Microsoft Customers
summary: Attack comes as many companies are racing to install a software fix. A cyberattack on Microsoft Corp.'s Exchange email software is believed to have infected tens of thousands of businesses, government offices and schools in the U.S., according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Real Meat That Vegetarians Can Eat
summary: Chicken nuggets grown from cells in a lab are now on sale in Singapore, heralding a new era of cruelty-free animal products. A few weeks ago, I sunk my teeth into a chicken nugget-the first one I'd eaten since I became a vegetarian 19 years ago. The tastes took me back to the fast food of my childhood. The crunchy exterior contrasted with the soft white flesh underneath, livened by a dash of hot sauce.

title: Covid-19 Pill Shows Promise in Preliminary Testing
summary: The antiviral reduced infectious virus in Covid-19 patients in a mid-stage study. An experimental Covid-19 drug that promises to be a kind of Tamiflu for the pandemic had positive results in a preliminary study, one of the drug's developers said.

title: Israeli Employers Offer Perks for the Inoculated
summary: Incentives range from access to on-site hair salons to T-shirts and even cash payments. TEL AVIV-The office security manager standing in the company cafeteria eyed a fellow-employee's wrists, which lacked the new must-have accessory at Check Point Software Technologies Ltd.

title: When Chamath Palihapitiya Speaks, Reddit and Wall Street Listen
summary: Resume Subscription. It was Jan. 4, and Chamath Palihapitiya was ready to tease another deal. "Shooters Shoot," he tweeted to his followers, along with a GIF of Alec Baldwin berating weary salesmen to "Always Be Closing." The retweets and likes for the "Glengarry Glen Ross" reference came fast and furious. "We're ready," one follower replied.

title: Senate Democrats Reach Deal to Advance Covid Relief Bill
summary: Deal with Sen. Joe Manchin ends daylong deadlock that threatened President Biden's relief package. WASHINGTON-Senate Democrats struck a deal Friday night to extend $300 weekly federal unemployment benefits through Sept. 6 following hours of negotiations with Sen. Joe Manchin, clearing the way for the $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief package's expected passage on Saturday.

summary: Resume Subscription. NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y.-A year ago, a father of four from this New York City suburb deteriorated in days from having a mild cough to feeling like he was drowning.

title: Pope Calls for Equal Rights for Christians at Start of Iraq Visit
summary: On his first day in the country, the pontiff will visit the site of a 2010 massacre of Christians. BAGHDAD-Pope Francis called for equal rights for Christians and other minorities in Iraq at the start of a densely scheduled visit fraught with public-health and security risks.

title: New York Lawmakers Move to Limit Cuomo's Pandemic Powers
summary: Democrat faces bipartisan rebuke over changes his administration made to a report on nursing home deaths. New York state lawmakers on Friday moved to curtail management powers granted to Gov. Andrew Cuomo during the coronavirus pandemic, as he faced bipartisan rebuke over changes his administration made to a report on Covid-19 nursing home deaths.

title: U.S. Proposes Afghan, Taliban Summit to Form Interim Government
summary: A U.S. envoy has proposed a gathering of Afghan and Taliban leaders, likely setting aside deal negotiated between Trump administration and Taliban and delaying a U.S. troop withdrawal. WASHINGTON-The top U.S. envoy to Afghanistan proposed the idea of a grand conference of Afghan and Taliban leaders to create an interim government, U.S. and Afghan officials said, reflecting a growing consensus in the Biden administration that peace talks between representatives of the two sides in Doha are moving too slowly.

title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry Interview With Oprah Fetches at Least $7 Million From CBS
summary: The network was seeking about $325,000 for 30 seconds of commercial time in highly-anticipated interview, ad buyers say. Talk isn't cheap when it comes to Oprah Winfrey, Prince Harry and Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle.

title: California to Allow Theme Parks, Stadiums to Open With Conditions
summary: State issues new Covid-19 guidelines that could allow reopening at 15% capacity as soon as April. California on Friday paved the way for Walt Disney Co. 's Disneyland and other attractions across the state to reopen as soon as next month, according to new guidelines on Covid-19 restrictions.
